Explanations about Options.-i(M):
Selects the file from which the identity (private key) for public key authentication
 is read. This option is directly passed to ssh(1).

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Use a specific ssh private key for authentication with the remote host

Explanations about Options.-p(C): Try running "telnet 1337" to verify that the port is at least accessible from where you're trying to connect. .  "Permission denied" for "ssh auser@192.168.1.2 -p 1337" suggests that, besides a firewall, your public key isn't properly installed.
Explanations about Options.-p(M):
Port to connect to on the remote host. This can be specified on a per-host basis in
 the configuration file.

Explanations about Options.-i(C): Test- "ssh -i ~/.ssh/new_keyname root@MY-IP"~. Copy- new key to server- "ssh-copy-id -i ~/.ssh/new_keyname root@MY-IP" 5.
Explanations about Options.-i(M):
Use only the key(s) contained in identity_file (rather than looking for identities
 via ssh-add(1) or in the default_ID_file). If the filename does not end in .pub
 this is added. If the filename is omitted, the default_ID_file is used.
